meanings.definition: relating to or derived from a clone
meanings.sent1: The clonally grown plants looked identical to each other.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the clonally reproduced cells in the lab.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how the clonally produced animals behaved exactly the same.
meanings.sent4: The clonally designed robots moved in perfect unison, like mirror images.
meanings.sent5: The field of genetics explores the fascinating world of clonally related organisms.

meanings.definition: in a manner characteristic of a clone
meanings.sent1: The virus spread clonally through the population, affecting everyone similarly.
meanings.sent2: The data was processed clonally, ensuring consistency across all results.
meanings.sent3: She danced clonally to the music, mimicking her friend's moves with precision.
meanings.sent4: The ideas in his mind multiplied clonally, forming a cohesive thought pattern.
meanings.sent5: The sound echoed clonally in the empty hall, creating a surreal effect.
